intro: Draba akmolensis, commonly known as the Akmolensk Draba, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly Kazakhstan. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically blooms in the spring and is adapted to rocky or arid environments. Draba akmolensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
